20110126181021.000|20110126181024.000|TR0|to grow, but when you talk about 
20110126181024.000|20110126181026.000|TR0|unemployment being four points better in 
20110126181026.000|20110126181029.000|TR0|this one community, this one state, that

20110126181036.000|20110126181039.000|TR0|doing that from here on out.
20110126181039.000|20110126181041.000|TR0|
20110126181041.000|20110126181044.000|TR0|VELSHI:  Let me parse this investment 
20110126181044.000|20110126181047.000|TR0|conversation, because, really, the 
20110126181047.000|20110126181049.000|TR0|President may lose control of this message 
20110126181049.000|20110126181052.000|TR0|if Republicans continue to label his use 
20110126181052.000|20110126181054.000|TR0|of the word "investment" as government 
20110126181054.000|20110126181057.000|TR0|spending.  The way the President, and his 
20110126181057.000|20110126181059.000|TR0|team, look at this is that, if you invest 
20110126181059.000|20110126181102.000|TR0|in things that will create businesses, 
20110126181102.000|20110126181104.000|TR0|become profitable, for instance, 
20110126181104.000|20110126181107.000|TR0|alternative energy, and employ people, the 
20110126181107.000|20110126181109.000|TR0|return to the economy is greater than if 
20110126181109.000|20110126181112.000|TR0|you didn't invest in it.  So, the idea is 
20110126181112.000|20110126181114.000|TR0|that something comes back to you in

20110126184959.000|20110126185002.000|TR0|to read, even a little extra sleep in the 
20110126185002.000|20110126185004.000|TR0|car? Sound dangerous, but there's new 
20110126185004.000|20110126185007.000|TR0|technology.  It's today's "Big I" and I 
20110126185007.000|20110126185009.000|TR0|want to break it down for you.
20110126185009.000|20110126185012.000|TR0|
20110126185012.000|20110126185014.000|TR0|It is called Safe Road Trains for the 
20110126185014.000|20110126185017.000|TR0|Environment or the SARTRE Project.  First, 
20110126185017.000|20110126185019.000|TR0|let's start with how it works.  Check out 
20110126185019.000|20110126185022.000|TR0|this animation.  You're driving down the 
20110126185022.000|20110126185024.000|TR0|street and you see this train, basically a 
20110126185024.000|20110126185027.000|TR0|train of cars.  Look at it, it's like a 
20110126185027.000|20110126185029.000|TR0|convoy, OK?  It's a truck-style vehicle in 
20110126185029.000|20110126185032.000|TR0|the front of the line, it can be anything.
20110126185032.000|20110126185035.000|TR0|
20110126185035.000|20110126185037.000|TR0|The train leader is able to control your 
20110126185037.000|20110126185040.000|TR0|acceleration, braking and steering using 
20110126185040.000|20110126185042.000|TR0|wireless technology in that vehicle and in 
20110126185042.000|20110126185045.000|TR0|yours. So if you join that train, they can 
20110126185045.000|20110126185047.000|TR0|control what you do.  So you send a 
20110126185047.000|20110126185050.000|TR0|request to the leader of the convoy.  
20110126185050.000|20110126185052.000|TR0|You're then able to sit back and relax 
20110126185052.000|20110126185055.000|TR0|while your car is basically pulled into 
20110126185055.000|20110126185057.000|TR0|the convoy, like this.
20110126185057.000|20110126185100.000|TR0|
20110126185100.000|20110126185102.000|TR0|When you want to leave, you send a signal 
20110126185102.000|20110126185105.000|TR0|to the leader.  You are then released from 
20110126185105.000|20110126185107.000|TR0|the convoy and you go about your merry 
20110126185107.000|20110126185110.000|TR0|way, you've got full control of your cars. 
20110126185110.000|20110126185112.000|TR0| The system then automatically closes the 
20110126185112.000|20110126185115.000|TR0|gap your car created by leaving.
20110126185115.000|20110126185118.000|TR0|
20110126185118.000|20110126185120.000|TR0|Now this technology has four major 
20110126185120.000|20110126185123.000|TR0|benefits.  Number one, it cuts congestion, 
20110126185123.000|20110126185125.000|TR0|it creates safer roads -- OK, cuts 
20110126185125.000|20110126185128.000|TR0|congestion, that's one of them.  Two, it 
20110126185128.000|20110126185130.000|TR0|creates safer roads.  Three, it lowers 
20110126185130.000|20110126185133.000|TR0|carbon emissions.  And, of course, four, 
20110126185133.000|20110126185135.000|TR0|all of that stuff I said you can do 
20110126185135.000|20110126185138.000|TR0|instead of driving.
20110126185138.000|20110126185140.000|TR0|
